item.title: Episode 328 - The Staircase: Michael Peterson - Part 1 | RedHanded
item.description: Podcast Description From the outside the Petersons had it all; the perfect family, a beautiful mansion and more money than they could spend. But on 9th December 2001 all that changed, when Michael Peterson claimed to have found his wife, Kathleen, dead at the bottom of their stairs. What followed would become a bizarre tale of strange family secrets, shocking revelations and a true crime case obsessed over like nothing before, or since.

item.title: Episode 327 - Murder in Ulvila | RedHanded
Episode 326 - Sarah Payne: Into Thin Air | RedHanded
item.description: Podcast Description Vanishing in seconds when her older brother turned away, 8-year-old Sarah Payne‚Äôs high-profile disappearance gripped the nation. But as mother and father begged for answers and hoped to see their little girl again, sadly it would leave a very different legacy. This truly heartbreaking case would change the British legal system forever ‚Äì not before Rebekah Brooks and ‚ÄòNews of The World‚Äô brought the British media into absolute chaos.

item.title: Episode 325 - The Vanishing of Lynette Dawson - Part 2 | RedHanded
item.description: Podcast Description The evidence against Chris Dawson was overwhelming from the start - so why did it take several investigations, 2 coronial enquiries and 40 years of agony for Lyon‚Äôs family for New South Wales police to even make an arrest? In our final episode on the murder of Lynette Dawson we discuss the day of her disappearance and the unfathomable lack of effort put into finding her. Not to mention why the police were so unwilling to investigate a man several officers referred to lovingly as ‚ÄòDawso‚Äô.

item.title: Episode 324 - The Vanishing of Lynette Dawson - Part 1 | RedHanded
item.description: Podcast Description When Lynette Dawson vanished without a trace in January 1982, her husband played the heartbroken victim. He was an abandoned father of two, with no choice but to move a 16-year-old student into the family home to help him out‚Ä¶ This is part 1 of the strange Australian tale. Expect shocking police corruption; rampant sex abuse running wild in the high schools of Sydney‚Äôs Northern Beaches; a man who thought he could get away with anything; and his strangely close relationship with his identical twin brother.

item.title: Bonus - Israel Keyes: Plan of Attack | RedHanded
item.description: Podcast Description You asked for it ‚Äì to say a huge final THANK YOU to all of you who brought us Gold in the Listeners' Choice category in this year‚Äôs BPAs, we promised you a bonus episode of your choice. item.title: Episode 323 - The Murder of Marvin Gaye ft. Disgraceland | RedHanded
item.description: Podcast Description The 1984 murder of one of Motown‚Äôs biggest stars ‚Äì at the hands of his abusive, alcoholic, cross-dressing Pentecostal-preacher father ‚Äì stunned the industry. But despite the media frenzy, almost no justice was served‚Ä¶ In this episode we look at Gaye‚Äôs life story, drawing a line from his early traumas to the whirlwind of violence, drugs and sex that seemed to follow him everywhere. And to tell the whole story, we‚Äôre joined this week by Jake Brennan ‚Äì host of the most-downloaded music podcast EVER: Disgraceland ‚Äì who dropped in to give us all the essential context behind one of the most notorious crimes in musical history.

item.title: Episode 322 - The Body, the P.I. & the Hole in the Wall | RedHanded
item.description: Podcast Description In 2010, the body of a man was discovered in a locked hotel room in Beaumont, Texas. Apart from some minor bruising on his groin, the man didn‚Äôt have a mark on him ‚Äì yet he had the internal damage of a severe car crash victim.  There was no sign of forced entry or a struggle. He had no enemies, and nobody in the hotel had seen or heard a thing.

item.title: Episode 319 - Lam Kor-wan: The Rainy Night Butcher | RedHanded
item.description: Podcast Description In August 1982, a Kodak technician was processing some photos when he saw the image of a naked young woman appear. He took a closer look, and any excitement he may have felt quickly disappeared when he realised she had been severely mutilated‚Ä¶ The ensuing investigation led to the conviction of Hong Kong‚Äôs first ever serial killer: Lam Kor-wan, known as the ‚ÄòRainy Night Butcher‚Äô, or ‚ÄòJars Killer‚Äô. Lam had been conducting sick dissections in a tiny bedroom he shared with his unwitting brother ‚Äì and keeping specimens, suspended in rice wine, in a grim collection of Tupperware containers under his bed.

item.title: Episode 318 - The 67 Exorcisms of Anneliese Michel | RedHanded
item.description: Podcast Description With fractured knees and savage bruises ‚Äì weighing just thirty kilos ‚Äì 23-year-old Anneliese Michel died in 1976 under some of the strangest circumstances imaginable. But despite looking like she‚Äôd been held and tortured against her will, she consented to all sixty-seven of the exorcisms she was subjected to. Why? Because Anneliese, her parents, and two-priests all believed she‚Äôd been possessed by a demon, and had become the mouthpiece of Adolf Hitler, Judas Iscariot, and even Lucifer himself

item.title: Episode 317 - Reverend Willie Maxwell: Harper Lee & The Killer Voodoo Preacher | RedHanded
item.description: Podcast Description In summer 1977, in Alexander City, Alabama, a man stood up in front of 300 mourners at the funeral of a 16-year-old girl ‚Äì and shot a reverend three times in the head. When the shooter‚Äôs murder trial began, it caught the attention of the renowned author, Harper Lee, who went on to spend years researching the story for her next book. But it wasn‚Äôt the shooting that had piqued her interest.

item.title: Delphi Update: Odinism & Accusations of Ritual Sacrifice | RedHanded
item.description: Podcast Description This week, Richard Allen‚Äôs defence team dropped a 136-page document challenging the warrant that police used to search his house. But it‚Äôs not as boring as it sounds ‚Äì because the bulk of this filing consists of claims that Abby and Libby were in fact killed by an Odinite, white-suprematist cult. And in doing so the defence team has revealed a lot of new information regarding the crime scene.

item.title: Episode 316 - Seth Rich: Murder in the Age of Conspiracy | RedHanded
item.description: Podcast Description If Seth Rich had had any other job ‚Äì or if it had been any other year ‚Äì his tragic death would likely have joined the 65 other unsolved murders in his part of Washington DC that year. But Seth worked for the Democratic Party ‚Äì and this was the summer of 2016. And while his family tried to grieve, Seth‚Äôs story was co-opted by every side. Through social media echo-chambering and shameless self-promotion, it grew to include accusations of bloodthirsty politicians; allegations of foreign powers destabilising US elections; and a secretive, high-powered paedophile ring that went all the way to the top.

item.title: Episode 315 - Christian Gerhartstreiter: The Talented Mr Mountbatten | RedHanded
item.description: Podcast Description In 1994, in the back garden of a house on Lorain Road, San Marino, California ‚Äì workers accidentally unearthed a shallow grave containing dismembered human remains.  Investigators were convinced that the discovery had something to do with a charming British man who‚Äôd lived at the property a decade before. Not only had he been a member of the British royal family, a celebrated actor, a director, an art collector, a physicist and a naval captain‚Ä¶ but he was also a member of the Rockefeller family ‚Äì with the same social security number as serial killer David Berkowitz‚Ä¶

item.title: Episode 314 - The Gilgo Beach Killings - Part 2 | RedHanded
item.description: Podcast Description On 13 July 2023 - after decades of corruption and inaction - police arrested 59-year-old New York architect Rex Heuermann, on suspicion of being the LISK. In this episode, we‚Äôll look at Heuermann‚Äôs family life, his background - and delve into the 33-page bail document that offers us an in-depth look at how investigators finally caught this notorious, modern American serial killer. Episode 311 - Bhagwan Rajneesh: The Rolls-Royce Driving Sex Guru | RedHanded
item.description: Podcast Description In July 1981, the 40 residents of Antelope, Oregon watched on in bemusement as their rural village was descended upon by an Indian guru and thousands of his followers.  Little did they know at the time, that these maroon-robed chanting hippies and their money-loving spiritual leader would go on to overthrow the local government, attempt wide-scale voter fraud, plot to fill a plane with explosives and eventually, carry out the most significant act of bioterrorism in US history.

Episode 309 - Thabo Bester: Twisted Firestarter | RedHanded
item.description: Podcast Description At 2am, on the 3rd of May last year ‚Äì inmates at Mangaung prison in Bloemfontein, South Africa, were woken up by an explosion. Word spread that Thabo Bester, the infamous ‚ÄúFacebook Rapist‚Äù, had set himself and his cell on fire. And all that remained after the dramatic blaze were a lighter, and a body, burnt beyond recognition. But that‚Äôs far from the end of the story.  With daily revelations from the trial still hitting headlines, expect a farcical morgue-robbing scheme, a massive-scale web of fraud conducted from inside a prison cell, and a glamorous celebrity doctor who‚Äôs not quite what she seems.

item.title: Episode 308 - Christine 'Chris Chan' Chandler: Lifelong Lolcow | RedHanded
item.description: Podcast Description Graphic Sonic fanfiction, a botched DIY sex change, incest and relentless psychosexual trolling are just some of the hallmarks of Christine Weston Chandler's story. As one of the most documented people in history ‚Äì with 2,500 Wiki articles covering everything from school reports to her parents‚Äô friends ‚Äì her almost biblical tale leaves little to the imagination. Yet most people have never heard of her.  Despite decades of online abuse, manipulation, and even extortion, the majority of those who do know about the infamous ‚ÄòChis Chan‚Äô see her as little more than an internet joke.

item.title: Episode 307 - Warren Jeffs: Bleeding the Beast - Part 2 | RedHanded
item.description: Podcast Description Last week, we looked at the formation of the ultra-obedient, bigamist Mormon cult, the FLDS ‚Äì in which plural marriage to pregnant preteen girls is just the tip of the fundamentalist iceberg. In this second part, we look at how its new prophet, Warren Jeffs, took his so-called religion to ever stricter and more terrifying depths.  With followers so beaten down that they were banned from even laughing; the prophet on the lam, living it up at Disneyland; and a team of ex-faithfuls and dogged investigators closing in ‚Äì something had to give.

item.title: Episode 306 - Warren Jeffs: God‚Äôs Chosen People - Part 1 | RedHanded
item.description: Podcast Description According to Warren Jeffs‚Äô thousands of followers, he was the leader of a secretive but devoted religion ‚Äì their prophet, and the representative of God on Earth. But according to US law, he was a dangerous, totalitarian, child-molesting horror with over 80 wives ‚Äì some married off as young as 12. Still, according to the church, Earthly laws are no match for the voice of God. In this episode, we explore the story behind the Fundamentalist Church of Jesus Christ of Latter Day Saints: how the visions of a charismatic, seventeen-year-old farmhand grew to become a major world religion; how plural marriage caused a major rift in the church; and how its teachings were warped into a systematic cult of child abuse, underage sex, and absolute power.

item.title: Episode 305 - Natalia Grace: The Orphan | RedHanded
Episode 304 - Jasmine Richardson & Jeremy Steinke: Natural Born Killers | RedHanded
item.description: Podcast Description Violently stabbed to death in their own home, the bodies of Debra and Marc Richardson showed the signs of an almighty struggle. The body of their eight-year-old son Tyler Jacob was upstairs, and their twelve-year-old daughter Jasmine was missing. It all suggested a brutal home invasion, with Jasmine‚Äôs abduction as the motive. Yet the narrative the police unwound was more confusing, disturbing ‚Äì and downright cringe-worthy ‚Äì than anything they could have imagined.

item.title: Episode 303 - Anthony Gignac: Prince of Fraud | RedHanded
item.description: Podcast Description How did an orphan from Bogot√°, Colombia, become one of the most audacious white-collar criminals in the US during early 2000s?  Starting his con career in Michigan at the age of just 12, Anthony Gignac transformed himself into a Saudi prince and spent three decades conning society‚Äôs elite out of millions ‚Äì until one day his royal fa√ßade cracked, when he ordered the wrong entr√©e at a restaurant‚Ä¶

item.title: Episode 302 - Grenfell Tower | RedHanded
item.description: Podcast Description On 14th June 2017, a fire engulfed Grenfell Tower, a high-rise residential building in West London.  74 people died, and the tragedy became one of the darkest days in recent British history. But worst of all, the incident was completely avoidable. This is the story of how decades of government corruption and unbelievable corporate greed killed so many innocent people. As part of our coverage of the Grenfell case, and to support those still affected today - we‚Äôre going to be donating a portion of our ad revenue from this episode to the Grenfell Foundation.

item.title: Episode 301 - Tupac & Biggie: 'Ready to Die' - Part 2 | RedHanded
item.description: Podcast Description In our second instalment, Hannah & Suruthi turn to Christopher George Latore Wallace ‚Äì better known as the Notorious B.I.G. ‚Äì and his side of the Biggie/Tupac saga. Lyrically gifted, privately educated and no stranger to a little crack dealing, Biggie became the face the East Coast rap scene in one of the genre's most volatile and dangerous eras.  So what happened to Tupac Shakur and Biggie Smalls? As H&S find out, sometimes the simplest explanation is the most likely.

item.title: REUPLOAD: Episode 257 - Genes & Justice: Kathleen Folbigg & Patricia Stallings | RedHanded
item.description: Podcast Description With the news that Kathleen Folbigg has finally been pardoned, we wanted to help you revisit this case, and Kathleen's incredibly tragic story by re-uploading our episode from August 2022. ‚ÄúOne sudden infant death is a tragedy, two is suspicious and three is murder‚Äù; this theory has pervaded criminal investigations for decades. So when Kathleen Folbigg‚Äôs daughter, Laura, became her fourth child to die mysteriously - Kathleen found herself labeled ‚ÄúAustralia‚Äôs Worst Female Serial Killer‚Äù.

item.title: Episode 300 - Tupac & Biggie: ‚Äò2 Of Amerikaz Most Wanted‚Äô - Part 1 | RedHanded
item.description: Podcast Description Stories of death, drugs, and gang violence were inextricably linked, in the 90s media, to the nation‚Äôs biggest rap stars.  Tupac Shakur was one of the decade‚Äôs biggest and most admired music icons ‚Äì until his life was cut tragically short in 1996. By the time he died, he‚Äôd been involved in three high-profile shootings, done time for sexual assault, and been associated with serious career criminals. So what happened?

item.title: Episode 299 - La Maison de L'Horreur: The Dupont de Ligonn√®s Family Murder | RedHanded
item.description: Podcast Description When five members of the cheery, churchgoing Dupont de Ligonn√®s family were found dead at their home in Nantes ‚Äì buried in the garden with small Catholic relics ‚Äì a million questions erupted from neighbours, family and friends. But for the police, only one question mattered: where was the sixth? Xavier Dupont de Ligonn√®s was nowhere to be found. And as they dug into his past, they uncovered a story that‚Äôs obsessed the nation of France for years: one of an ancient aristocratic dynasty, of international espionage, and a crime scene that, decades later, still refuses to add up‚Ä¶

item.title: TRIAL UPDATE & REUPLOAD: Episode 180 - Lori Vallow: Doomsday | RedHanded
item.description: Podcast Description To make sure that none of you miss out we've updated our episode on Lori Vallow to include an update on her trial! Listen to this episode and this week's episode of ShortHand for the full scoop. 47-year-old mum of 3, Lori Vallow was convinced of two things; she was a god and the world was ending. Her job was to prepare her people for the second coming of Christ, in July 2020.

item.title: Episode 298 - Papa Doc: Haiti‚Äôs Vodou Dictator | RedHanded
item.description: Podcast Description What kind of leader would say of his own people that they are ‚Äúmeant to suffer‚Äù? Well, maybe a savage despot who claimed to be the master of the dead ‚Äì a powerful sorcerer who could use vodou to raise murderous zombies at will, read minds, and even assassinate a US president‚Ä¶ Francois Duvalier, known as ‚ÄòPapa Doc‚Äô, is one of the most ruthless dictators of the 20th Century, responsible for the deaths of an estimated 60,000 people, and a reign of terror that tragically reverberates through Haiti to this day.

item.title: Episode 297 - Martha Moxley: Death & Dynasty | RedHanded
item.description: Podcast Description On Halloween morning, 1975, in one of the most exclusive gated communities in the USA, the bludgeoned body of 15-year-old Martha Moxley was discovered on her own front lawn. The shattered pieces of the murder weapon, a six-iron golf club, were found nearby. The police had the body, they had the weapon, and they had a strong indication of who took her life. But this was going to be anything but an open and shut-case.

item.title: Episode 296 - Evil Genius: The ‚ÄòPizza Bomber‚Äô | RedHanded
item.description: Podcast Description When delivery driver Brian Wells wound up with a bomb strapped to his neck after trying to fulfill a seemingly normal order of 2 pepperoni pizzas, local police thought their strange day had come to a dramatic end. In reality, it was the start‚Ä¶ By the end of their investigation they‚Äôd have to solve a scavenger hunt, track down a woman known as ‚Äúcrazy Marge‚Äù, and defrost the body of a mystery man tossed inside a freezer.

item.title: Episode 295 - The Christchurch Massacre | RedHanded
item.description: Podcast Description On the 15th of March, 2019, a 28-year-old man walked into a mosque in Christchurch, New Zealand, holding a shotgun and semi-automatic rifle ‚Äì and opened fire.  And what set this story apart was not just its brutality, but also the way it was staged ‚Äì from the internet, for the internet. item.title: Episode 294 - Roderick Newall: Death in Paradise | RedHanded
item.description: Podcast Description The sleepy island of Jersey is a safe haven for wealthy Brits to live out their retirement with favourable weather, and an even more favourable tax rate. So when Nicholas and Elizabeth Newall were found bludgeoned to death in their home, the local police were a little out of their depth. item.title: Morbid Caught RedHanded: The Witches of Long Compton | RedHanded
item.description: Podcast Description It‚Äôs finally happening ‚Äì the Morbid X RedHanded collab! item.title: Episode 293 - Gabby Petito: Isolated | RedHanded
item.description: Podcast Description In December 2020 Gabby Petito and her fiance Brian Laundrie set off on a once-in-a-lifetime journey across the USA in their tiny little van. The trip was set to be packed full of starry nights and stunning vistas for countless happy memories, and also all the beautiful views needed to kickstart Gabby‚Äôs dream career as a travel vlogger. But when Brian returned to his family home in August 2021 without Gabby, things went from living daydream to living nightmare.

item.title: Episode 292 - Griekwastad: The Steenkamp Family Massacre | RedHanded
item.description: Podcast Description The sleepy town of Griekwastad South Africa woke up to absolute horror on Good Friday 2012. Three members of the local Steenkamp family had been brutally murdered, leaving their 17-year-old son Don as the only survivor. As the dust settled people blamed everything from a so-called ‚Äòwhite genocide farm attack‚Äô to a Satanic Cult. However, the reality and the family secrets that emerged were far darker than anything cooked up by the press.

item.title: Episode 291 - The Silk Road: Drugs, Data & The Dread Pirate Roberts | RedHanded
item.description: Podcast Description For some, the end of the world’s most infamous online marketplace was a major victory in the never ending war on drugs. But for others, the global, multi-agency investigation into the Silk Road set a dangerous precedent for law enforcement ‚Äì who rifled through the personal data of countless innocent users in their hunt for the elusive online drug-lord/revolutionary: Dread Pirate Roberts. So prepare for a trip on the Silk Road, and find out how a tax inspector hanging out on a hallucinogenic mushroom forum caught one of the most slippery criminals we‚Äôve ever covered.

item.title: Episode 290 - Jack Parsons: The Occultist Sex-Crazed Father of Modern Rocketry | RedHanded
item.description: Podcast Description From Copernicus to Newton, the greatest minds in history have had a crater named after them on the moon. But one name you may not know is Jack Parsons, a pioneer of rocket science whose contributions were so monumental that man wouldn‚Äôt have set foot on the moon without him. However, his sex-crazed occultism and bromance with L. Ron Hubbard made it hard for the scientific community to embrace him, leading to his eponymous crater being placed on the dark side of the moon.

item.title: Episode 289 - David vs Robin: The Bain Family Killings - Part 2 | RedHanded
item.description: Podcast Description Last week we left off with the absolutely batshit-craziness of Margaret‚Äôs ‚ÄúBel‚Äù-filled diaries and the rumoured accusations of incest made by Laniet Bain against her father Robin. item.title: Episode 287 ‚Äì The Murdaugh Family Murders | RedHanded
item.description: Podcast Description The Murdaugh murders are not one story; they are a seemingly endless web of lies, entitlement, and confusion.¬†At the centre of the web are the bodies of Paul and Maggie Murdaugh, found at their hunting lodge. item.title: Episode 286 - Emanuela Orlandi: The Vatican‚Äôs Only Missing Citizen | RedHanded
item.description: Podcast Description Organised crime, sex scandals, terror plots, hundreds of millions of missing dollars, a gangster known as ‚ÄòGod‚Äôs Banker‚Äô found hanging from a bridge in London, a 100-year-old apocalyptic prophecy, an anonymous tip-off that sounds like it comes from Dan Brown‚Äôs never-released Godfather sequel, and messages hidden in crypts‚Ä¶this is the story of Emanuela Orlandi, the only missing citizen of the smallest country in the world.¬†And though she disappeared more than 40 years ago, Emanuela‚Äôs story remains, to this day, one of the biggest mysteries in Italian criminal history.

item.title: Episode 285 - The Murder of Rachel Nickell | RedHanded
item.description: Podcast Description Rachel Nickell‚Äôs brutalised body was found on Wimbledon Common with her two-year-old son Alex wiping her bloodied face and begging her to ‘wake up’. The nature of the broad daylight attack and the horrific injuries put enormous pressure on the Met to get the case solved and fast. However, none of that justifies the shoddy police work, cut corners, and tunnel vision that allowed a serial rapist to go unchecked for years.

item.title: Episode 284 - Dorothea Puente: The Boarding House of Death | RedHanded
item.description: Podcast Description Dorothea Puente may have looked every bit the placid old lady she played. In reality, she was in her early fifties, and was using her self-made status as a ‚Äòpillar of the community‚Äô to divert attention away from what was buried and rotting in her garden.¬†Whether her victims had a few hundred thousand dollars, a nice pick-up truck, or even just a meagre social security cheque ‚Äì they all risked the wrath of the ‚ÄòDeath House Landlady‚Äô.

item.title: Episode 283 - Rasputin: Russia‚Äôs Greatest Love Machine | RedHanded
item.description: Podcast Description The much-told legend of Rasputin ‚Äì the giant, wild-eyed, well-hung, wandering Siberian monk who seduced the Tsarina herself ‚Äì is mostly a bunch of absolute borscht. But the real story is just as wild.¬†H&S look at the life of a peasant who infiltrated Russian nobility, embodying the tensions of a nation ‚Äì a charismatic zealot who mysteriously healed the Romanovs‚Äô sickly heir.¬†So join us to find out how Russia went from Romanovs to Revolution; the possible MI6 ties to Rasputin‚Äôs death; and a classic, quick-fire RedHanded rundown of‚Ä¶the entire First World War.

item.title: Episode 282 - Jeffrey Epstein: Foul Play - Part 2 | RedHanded
item.description: Podcast Description In 2009, having served just 13 months of the cushiest jail sentence this side of Scandinavia, Jeffrey Epstein was free ‚Äì and legally protected from any future punishment. But there were hundreds of people that knew what he really was: a dangerous, influential and insatiable child rapist with a sophisticated network of fixers. They knew he had to be stopped. In this second episode of our two-parter, H&S look at the tireless legal and journalistic efforts to bring him down; go deeper into the involvement of Ghislaine Maxwell and Prince Andrew; and find out what kind of justice ‚Äì if any ‚Äì was served.

item.title: Episode 281 - Jeffrey Epstein: Along Came a Spider - Part 1 | RedHanded
item.description: Podcast Description The story of Jeffrey Epstein ‚Äì the billionaire financier with an industrial-scale web of child abuse implicating some of the most powerful people in the world ‚Äì sounds like some half-baked conspiracy theory. But it‚Äôs all true. And to answer the question of how he went from humble origins to sex-trafficking minors over to his private island, we have to start at the very beginning.¬†So, who exactly was Jeffrey Epstein?
